评论概述: Not tall girl friendly but soooo cute if under 5’6
评论详情: Alright- since I’m a tall girl ( 5’8 almost 5’9 ) I’m always looking for helpful reviews with measurements so I don’t waste my time and money . So here ya go .. these dickies cargo pants have so much potential . They are soft and very flattering. The cost on Amazon is so much better than just buying these at Tilly’s or other mall stores . The inseam is 30 inches and sit like high waters at my ankles . The waist measures 16 inches across laying flat . They sit low on my waist unlike other dickies that might as well go to my neck. So bottom line - super cute , soft , and will work great for those who are 5’6 and under - who plan on wearing them with sneakers 👟

Hello, I have purchased the Dickies women's cargo pant, relaxed fit in size 10 R. The material is soft and feels broken in. My concern is with the fit and pattern cut. The left leg is snug at the pocket area and the inseam is closer to the top of my leg. The seam across the rear pulls towards the left. I have submitted photos and a video. I purchased the Dickies carpenter pants for landscaping and home repair. I am reaching out to request a credit or discount. It's not good for the environment to send them back as a return and end up on a shelf or in a bag. As the pants can be serviceable. Thank you for your consideration. Kim

评论概述: Dress cargo pants--not real cargo pants
评论详情: Update:  I lost a little weight so tried a smaller size in the stretch camo.  The camo "color" is cute but as others have noted, for some odd reason, the "phone" pocket on stretch versions is on the right leg and positioned behind the cargo pocket reducing the usefulness of both.  I feel like the cargo pockets are also a little shorter, or at least the velcro is shorter.  I plan to add velcro to the top of the pocket so the flap secures easier and more securely when carrying my phone.  Unless you really need the stretch fabric, the 100% cotton version is more practical.  I still wish the fabric was thicker.Original:  I have these in several colors, all the 100% cotton versions (the "rinsed" ones--the non-rinsed colors are not 100% cotton).  The material is comfortable but somewhat thin.  I only use the flapped cargo pockets and the "phone" pocket--which is not large enough for my phone but works for a pen and 3x5 notepad (and is slightly in front of the cargo pocket), so I cannot comment on the usefulness of the other pockets.  The flapped cargo pockets barely fit my phone.  They are also positioned much too low to be comfortable long-term.I normally wear men's cargo pants which have huge pockets and thick material, but they are not "dressy" in the least.  I wanted something more sleek and classy for social events that allows me to carry a phone and small wallet, and these fit the bill.  As others have noted, the waistband is huge in the back.  I typically wear a belt, so that doesn't bother me too much.  The legs do flair a lot--they are not straight legged--but look fine with boots (also my normal footwear).  I feel like the rise is too high in front, and I have received a few pairs that are much too high.  So quality control isn't the best.  I've received pairs where the front rise is more than an inch higher than other pairs of the same size and color.These "work" for my needs, barely.  They are not work pants.  They are too thin and the pockets are small and poorly positioned.  But they are decent "dress" pants for someone who doesn't want to carry a purse.  But you will need a belt.

I love whatever changes Dickie’s made as far as fabric goes, they’re way more comfortable than previous ones. My only issue with this particular style is that the small pocket that sits right above the cargo pocket used to be on the left side and is now not only on the right but is no longer allowing space for my box cutter without interfering with the cargo pocket operation. Not the end of the world, just inconvenient.

If you are a woman in need of a good quality, good fiting pair of working pants, these may not be for you. The quality of the fabric and materials are excellent as usual for this brand, but the fit is absolutely awful, I just can't understand how they create pants that fit this way, is like they did this for men and didn't bother to change the shape for women. I'm 5'3", size Small/Medium and ordered the medium size, it magically gave me a muffin top (I don't have one) and stayed very low on my hips, so any time I bent over, my underwear showed in the back, they just felt so incredibly uncomfortable all over, so definitely not working pants, can't bed over, can't squat, have to worry about all the cat hair the black fabric picked up, have to worry about having a new muffin top and looking unkempt. I returned them the very same day.

Good quality of material however after wearing them for a few hours they stretched out and were super baggy. Ordered a 12 and wanted to reorder in a smaller size but wasn’t available. I am 176 and 5 foot 4.

This product is definitely roomy for the active lifestyle. Baggy enough in hips and thigh area and large down the calf to feet. I cater for a university in SC, USA and we are constantly busy with events. Especially doing sports events when we cater the elites and teams and spring formalwear gaila, not to mention tailgate and many more on campus all on same day. Loading up vans and unloading and in and out and up stairs and down stairs and bending and stretching all day long is a must. These pants are perfect to carry pens, note pads, paperwork and much more. Heavy duty material keeps up with me all day. What I don't like :: color fades (black) no support in hips and i ordered a size smaller (unintentional) and still need a belt.
The fit is amazing!! The color faded after a few washes but that is expected.
